senses.de: Having too many people or things in one place
senses.ex: The bus was overcrowded and we had to stand most of the journey.

Tips.title: Physical Space
Tips.description: Focuses on limited physical space affecting comfort and function.
Tips.example: The overcrowded classroom made it hard to focus on the lesson.

Tips.title: Negative Feeling
Tips.description: Carries a negative tone suggesting discomfort or stress.
Tips.example: Feeling claustrophobic, he left the overcrowded party.

Tips.title: Situational Context
Tips.description: Used in contexts such as public transport, living spaces, or events.
Tips.example: She avoids the overcrowded subway during rush hour.

senses.de: To put too many people or things into a space that is too small
senses.ex: The city has been overcrowded with tourists throughout the summer.

Tips.title: Action Oriented
Tips.description: Explains a process or condition in which an area becomes too filled.
Tips.example: Tour guides usually overcrowded the exhibit by welcoming too many visitors at once.

Tips.title: Implies Excess
Tips.description: Emphasizes the excessive addition of people or items beyond capacity.
Tips.example: The manager overcrowded the schedule with back-to-back meetings.

Tips.title: Planning Failure
Tips.description: Suggests poor planning or management leading to uncomfortable situations.
Tips.example: The festival was overcrowded due to poor ticketing arrangements.

Congested.wordDefinition:
Congested refers specifically to something that has a lot of traffic or a lot of people in one place and is difficult to move in.

They both essentially mean there are too many things in one place, but congested is about movement and overcrowded is about space.

Cram.wordDefinition:
Cram refers to the act of forcefully fitting a large amount of something into a small space. This can be applicable in situations where you have to squeeze a lot of items or information into a limited space or amount of time.

For example, you might cram for a test by studying a lot of information in a short amount of time.

Inundate.wordDefinition:
Inundate means to flood or overwhelm with a large amount of something, usually with water or information. For example, "The city was inundated with rain, causing flooding in the streets" or "I was inundated with emails after I announced the sale.".

So, while both words refer to an excess of something, inundate typically refers to a sudden overflow or overwhelming amount, while overcrowded refers to something being too crowded or full for comfort or efficiency.

Pack.wordDefinition:
Pack refers to filling a space tightly or completely, often with objects rather than people. This can refer to packing a suitcase full for a vacation, or packing a box with books for moving.

Overcrowded applies to spaces that have too many people, while pack refers to filling a space tightly with objects.

Swarm.wordDefinition:
Swarm refers to a large group of people or animals moving together.

It can also refer to a large number of insects flying or crawling together. For example, bees might swarm around a hive, or a group of birds might swarm together in the sky.

So, while overcrowded refers to a place that has too many things in it, swarm refers to a large group of things moving or existing together.

Teem.wordDefinition:
Teem means that a place is full of activity or moving things.

Overcrowded is used when a place has too much of something, while teem describes a place that is active and bustling with life.

Throng.wordDefinition:
Throng means a crowd of people bustling around a particular place.

This word describes a lively and busy situation where people are gathered in a particular area for a specific reason. For instance, a throng of people may gather at a music festival or at a popular tourist attraction.

Overcrowded is used when there is a lack of space for too many people while throng is about a busy crowd of people gathered for a particular reason.

quotes.Text: You begin to see that all of these things are connected: The kind of cuts that mean less environmental protection are also the kind of cuts that mean less musical education for the schools and that also mean more overcrowded schools.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Robert Hass

quotes.Text: The Vampire Diaries' is a great show, but it's on the verge of being overcrowded. The amount of characters, a lot of them don't get screen time because there's so much to put in, and it has to center around the love triangle.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Joseph Morgan

quotes.Text: Failure to properly control our borders costs citizens in many ways: schools become overcrowded, medical resources are stretched too thin, other government services are overtaxed, and taxes increase further.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Zach Wamp

quotes.Text: We are in danger of destroying ourselves by our greed and stupidity. We cannot remain looking inwards at ourselves on a small and increasingly polluted and overcrowded planet.
quotes.Title: English Physicist
quotes.Name: Stephen Hawking

quotes.Text: Few enjoy noisy overcrowded functions. But they are a gesture of goodwill on the part of host or hostess, and also on the part of guests who submit to them.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Fannie Hurst

quotes.Text: Poverty damages the educational potential of children, whether through stress or poor diet, while overcrowded, poor-quality housing has the same impact too.
quotes.Title: British Journalist
quotes.Name: Owen Jones

quotes.Text: Prison conditions in some parts of the world can be very poor, overcrowded and, in some cases, dangerous and sentences can be much tougher than in the U.K.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: David Lidington

quotes.Text: Why is the rest of the world so overcrowded? Nobody lives in America! We're all squashed up on top of each other in London.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Noel Gallagher

quotes.Text: We are already overcrowded. There's no more room, and we must shut the borders.
quotes.Title: Dutch Politician
quotes.Name: Pim Fortuyn

quotes.Text: Desperation is a fact of life in many poor, overcrowded countries.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Anthony Lewis
